items.text: more air on that one, he comes forward to defend it back to the bowler
items.shortText: Aponso to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: given some air again but wider, and that allows Mushfiqur to square drive it for a couple
items.shortText: Aponso to Mushfiqur Rahim, 2 runs

items.text: a little bit of turn. Bowled on the stumps and he comes forward to defend and smother the ball
items.shortText: Aponso to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.preText: Mithun's previous highest ODI score by the way, was 26. So this is a considerable improvement on that. And much needed. But here's Malinga back. Can he do some magic?
items.text: carefully steered towards point where Dhananjaya makes a diving stop to his left
items.shortText: Malinga to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: straighter and pushed to mid-on. Malinga's still getting the ball to wobble a wee bit
items.shortText: Malinga to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.preText: He's pulled out just as Malinga is about to deliver. A ball boy was walking across the sightscreen
items.text: Finally a catch is taken good length delivery that probably bounced more than Mithun expected. He wanted to hit across the line to midwicket, but only got a leading edge that went steepling. The 'keeper called for it early and caught it safely. Malinga's fairytale comeback continues
items.shortText: Malinga to Mohammad Mithun, OUT

dismissal.text: Mohammad Mithun c †MDKJ Perera b Malinga 63 (68b 5x4 2x6) SR: 92.64

items.preText: akshay : "where is akila danjaya, he would be very effective in this game.. as no other Sri Lankan spinners struggling... " - he's on leave for the birth of his child. He'll be back for Sri Lanka's second match
items.text: strays down leg and is tucked to square leg
items.shortText: Malinga to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: Length ball on off and defended watchfully into the offside
items.shortText: Malinga to Mahmudullah, no run

items.text: length on off again, Mahmudullah gets off the mark by opening the face of the bat to run it down to third man
items.shortText: Malinga to Mahmudullah, 1 run

items.preText: "Malinga will end up with 5 with wickets and will score winning runs for SL. You heard it first here. " - If this comes true Amit, I'll be needing your number and email. You know, for research purposes
items.text: pushed into the offisde
items.shortText: Aponso to Mahmudullah, no run

items.text: Taken at cover! Wild heave across the line that only got a top edge. Dhananjaya has been Sri Lanka's best fielder and luckily he was the one nearest to the ball. Moved to his left, and dived to grab the ball.
items.shortText: Aponso to Mahmudullah, OUT

dismissal.text: Mahmudullah c de Silva b Aponso 1 (4b 0x4 0x6) SR: 25.00

items.preText: Murtaza Alibhai: "Lot of drop catches... Conditions Are Tough But Malinga Still Have Some Juice Left In This Asia Cup And Definately Worldcup 2019... Srilanka Need Him Big Time!" - if he bowls like this, he could be leading the attack in the World Cup
items.text: flighted on off and pushed to point
items.shortText: Aponso to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: goes wider of the stumps and gets it to straighten a mite from the stumps. Defended back
items.shortText: Aponso to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: a bit flatter and quicker, punched back to the bowler
items.shortText: Aponso to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: premeditated sweep, but it pays off. He takes it from outside off and gets it fine, where it beats Malinga to roll into the fine-leg fence
items.shortText: Aponso to Mushfiqur Rahim, FOUR runs

items.preText:
Jay Deshpande: "My god. It is 43 degrees Celsius. How can they allow matches in that hot weather? This is ridiculous, I think there should be a rule that matches played in excess of 37-38 degrees Celsius should be called off. Playing in extreme weather is very unhealthy and dangerous. You can even die of dehydration "

Arun: "Who plays cricket in this part of the world during this time, that to starting at 230pm.It will be disaster for players."

It's certainly not easy conditions. The start time by the way is 3.30 pm
items.text: full and on the stumps, driven back to mid-on
items.shortText: Malinga to Mosaddek Hossain, no run

items.text: digs it in short and Mosaddek is slightly late on the pull. Good work by midwicket to dive and stop the ball inside the circle
items.shortText: Malinga to Mosaddek Hossain, 1 run

items.text: strays down leg and is clipped to fine-leg
items.shortText: Malinga to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: some wobble, full and on the stumps. driven to mid-on
items.shortText: Malinga to Mosaddek Hossain, no run

items.preText: An update from Mohammad Isam, our Bangladesh correspondent: Tamim won't be batting today
items.text: pushed into the offside
items.shortText: Malinga to Mosaddek Hossain, no run

items.text: Malinga has four! shortened his length and got it chest high on the legside. He tried to paddle it fine but only got a top edge that looped towards the keeper, who had a fairly easy take.
items.postText:
Sreshth will now be back to see how many Malinga can finish with.

Akshita: "Classic Bangladesh VS Classic Malinga! Nightmarish Dejavu for Bangla fans."
items.shortText: Malinga to Mosaddek Hossain, OUT

dismissal.text: Mosaddek Hossain c †MDKJ Perera b Malinga 1 (5b 0x4 0x6) SR: 20.00

items.text: full on middle stump, and he's down on one knee to play to sweep. Fielder in the deep cleans up
items.postText: Sailesh Thapa : "Cricket indeed is a game of uncertainty! Bangladesh have had a horrible start and few overs before they were cruising and now, srilanka are back top. May be still some twist remain, depends upon the innings of mushi. "
items.shortText: Aponso to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: tossed up on off, and he takes a big stride forward to meet the ball. Driven firmly to wide long off
items.shortText: Aponso to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 1 run

items.preText: Varun: "Apart from Malinga, the rest have conceded 130 in 22 overs. Worrying."
items.text: tossed up on off, and that's been driven past the bowler's left for a single
items.shortText: Aponso to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: full on leg stump, and he nudges this square to the leg side. No one's there at square leg, and therefore Shanaka cleans up in the deep
items.postText: Abdul Moeed: "There was this whole talk about "Nagan Dance" before the start of this match. Ultimately, its "Slinga - The Malinga" who has made the batsmen dance on his own rhythm."
items.shortText: Aponso to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 1 run
